Description:
Job Brief The Quality Assurance Officer is responsible for monitoring and improving the quality of operational processes and procedures in the restaurant organization and production facility. Playing a key role in identifying areas for improvement, implementing quality control measures, and ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations. Responsibilities Conduct regular audits and inspections of operational processes to assess compliance with quality standards.
Identify areas where operational processes can be optimized for efficiency and effectiveness.
Develop and implement quality control measures and procedures to minimize errors and defects in operations.
Monitor and enforce adherence to quality control procedures.
Provide training to staff on quality control procedures and best practices. Skills
Skills:
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Business, Quality Management, Operations Management) or equivalent work experience related to Hospitality.
Proven experience in quality control, process improvement, or a related role.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of quality management systems and methodologies (Basic Food Hygiene or PIC Certification).
Familiarity with regulatory requirements and industry standards relevant to the organization.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Detail-oriented with a strong commitment to accuracy and precision.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

Data.Company Industry: Catering, Food Service, & Restaurant; Food & Beverage Production
